sources.data_found: CMU has acquired a compute cluster with 296 Nvidia H100 GPUs and 37 compute nodes. Each compute node is a Google Cloud Platform reserved instance Virtual Machine (VM), an a3-megagpu-8g. FLAME Partition: 256 H100 GPUs. Community Partition: 40 H100 GPUs.

TRACE (Tartan Research Advanced Computing Environment): 29 x NVIDIA Ampere A40 (optimized for direct compute), 4 x NVIDIA Ampere A16 (optimized for VMs), 33 x Dual AMD EPYC 7713 (64-core), 24 x Dual AMD EPYC 9474F (48-core).
Arjuna cluster: Total number of 1,792 CPU cores and 112 GPUs. Equipped with GPUs donated by Nvidia.
Neuroscience Institute cluster: 22 CPU nodes and 10 GPU nodes with 4 GPU cards in each. Total of 568 CPUs, 32 GPU cards.
Bridges-2 at Pittsburgh Supercomputing Center: Adding 10 HPE Cray 670 nodes with 8 H100-SXM5-80GB GPUs each = 80 H100 GPUs. PSC has existing V100-based GPU nodes.
Carnegie Mellon University awarded 2,130 degrees in Computer and Information Sciences and Support Services in 2023. Total enrollment: 15,596 students.

student_data.notes: DataUSA reports 2,130 CS degrees awarded in 2023. Estimated enrollment based on: ~150 first-year CS students × 4 years = 600 undergrads (conservatively increased to 750 to account for growth and transfers), MS programs ~850 (typical 1.5-2 year programs), PhD ~530 (5-6 year programs). Total SCS enrollment approximately 2,130 active students.

other_high_vram_gpus.model: NVIDIA Ampere A16 (64GB total per card, 4x16GB vGPUs)

other_high_vram_gpus.notes: Neuroscience Institute cluster: 10 nodes × 4 GPUs/node = 40 total; 32 listed as 'GPU cards' (model unspecified)

gpu_resources.notes:
GPU TOTALS BY CLUSTER:

1) Google ORCHARD Cluster: 296 H100 SXM (37 nodes × 8 H100/node)
2) Bridges-2 (PSC): 80 H100 SXM (10 nodes × 8 H100/node)
3) TRACE (Engineering): 29 A40 + 4 A16
4) Arjuna (Engineering, 2017): 112 GPUs (likely older generation, counted as V100)
5) Neuroscience Institute: 32 GPU cards (model unspecified)

Total H100: 296 (ORCHARD) + 80 (Bridges-2) = 376

compute_credits.description: Google Cloud cluster access is free to faculty during 2-year pilot period. Other clusters use recharge models.

analysis_notes: CMU has made significant GPU infrastructure investments in 2024-2025, particularly the 296 H100 Google ORCHARD cluster and 80 H100 Bridges-2 upgrade. Student enrollment estimated from degree completions; exact enrollment by program level not published publicly.
